title: Leeds United Live: Leeds 1-0 Preston - BBC News
summary: all the action and reaction as leeds united take on preston north end .
luke murphy in for tom adeyemi ; sam byram starts again for leeds .
alan browne own goal gives leeds the lead seconds after the break .

documents.title: good eveningleeds 0-0 preston
text: leeds have moved up to 13th in the championship and it 's back to back wins - but boy , was it hard work .
leeds controlled the game for the most part but the last twenty minutes saw preston dominate .
you can hear our post-match interview with steve evans over on our audio page .
we 'll be back on 27th december for the game against nottingham forest .
thank you for joining us , and merry christmas !

documents.title: more from evansleeds 0-0 preston
text: with the benefit of hindsight , taking luke murphy off was a poor decision .
we comfortably got into their half but people were overrunning the final ball .
we have been trying to recover these boys from thursday 's game and i will make sure they are fresh for nottingham forest .
the schedule is absolutely disgraceful , that is the bottom line .
we are such a powerful ground but i feel for the players that have to go and perform .
our supporters have the right to turn up and see a fresh team .
i will give them a day or two and they will have certain things they have to follow and they will be fresh for after christmas .

documents.title: reaction from steve evansleeds 1-0 preston
text: it was always going to be gritty today .
it was a determined performance that got us over the line .
it was always going to be tough .
we had more zip in our legs in the first half , but marco in goal is just getting better and better .

documents.title: more from noelleeds 1-0 preston
text: we 've seen on many occasions that ten men are sometimes harder to play than 11 .
the game was there for the taking but leeds huffed and puffed .
silvestri was called upon many times and he was excellent but that should n't be the case against ten men .
author: Noel Whelan
Ex-Leeds United striker

documents.title: noel on today 's gameleeds 1-0 preston
text: it was n't pretty , it was n't a great second half , but they got the job done .
you have to match them .
- when they up the pace , you have to and you have to control the state of the game .
it did n't look like we had the extra energy throughout that second half .
the runs were n't right , the passes were n't tight and it was all too heavy .
author: Noel Whelan
Ex-Leeds United striker

documents.title: popey on today 's winleeds 1-0 preston
text: that was bonkers .
why do we have these heart attacks over this team ?
you name it , we 've gone through it !
marco silvestri has been absolutely outstanding this match , he 's saved leeds .
author: Adam Pope
BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: full time : leeds 1-0 preston
text: well , it 's come via an own goal , but leeds have their third win in four games .
that was a mixed game from leeds .
they were very strong once preston had their keeper jordan pickford sent off , and the own goal almost instantly after the break boosted them .
however they were unable to finish preston off , something they 've struggled with all season .
it was all a bit sloppy towards the end , and leeds really should have made that win much easier than it was , but their winning streak continues .

text: soulemayne doukara breaks and he finds mirco antenucci on the left , but the keeper is forward to smother it .

documents.title: breakingown goal : leeds 1-0 preston
text: great start to the second half for leeds united ; less so for the preston defender who has just knocked the ball into his own net .
it was a lovely cross in from stuart dallas towards chris wood , who was doing his best to get to the ball .
alan browne , running forward , tried to clear but headed it past keeper matt hudson to give leeds the lead .
oops .

documents.title: noel on the first halfleeds 0-0 preston
text: we have to turn that pressure into a goal .
we did n't start off very well .
the passing was slow and we were dwelling on the ball .
after a couple of flying challenges and they got the crowd going , they started to enjoy the physical side of the game and up their tempo .
everything is in leeds ' favour but they have to be patient and not rush it .
author: Noel Whelan
Ex-Leeds United striker

documents.title: half time : leeds 0-0 preston
text: a red card , a 17-year-old keeper and chances for both sides ; it 's shaping up into a decent game at elland road .
preston had the best of the opening ten minutes but once leeds woke up they posed a real threat .
jordan pickford 's red card for a handball outside the area saw preston down to ten men and leeds take it up a notch .

documents.title: head to headleeds v preston
text: the last four games between these two sides has seen 21 goals scored - nine for leeds and 12 for preston .
preston have found themselves in a similar situation to leeds at the start of the season , with draws coming easier than wins .
the visitors have lost just one of their last 14 games but they have registered nine draws in the past 16 matches .
today might not be the goalfest of the past but , with one place and one point separating these two in the championship , both sides will be pushing for victory .

documents.title: reminder of the teamsleeds v preston
text: reminder of the teamsleeds v preston

documents.title: fortress elland road ? leeds v preston
text: steve evans will be hoping that the recent run of results can lead to a change in fortune for leeds at home .
the whites went 12 games without a win at elland road but they have won two and lost one of their last three at home .
leeds have also scored just seven goals at home this season , a league low .
preston 's away record is also pretty impressive - they have kept the most clean sheets away from home in the championship .

documents.title: last time outleeds v preston
text: the last time these two sides met it was an absolute goalfest , with preston emerging on top in a 6-4 victory .
leeds took an early lead before luciano becchio and alex bruce chipped in to give them a 4-1 lead .
jon parkin 's hat-trick was the turning point for preston , who went on to stun the elland road faithful .
the defeat came when simon grayson was manager at united - no doubts he 'll be hoping for a similar outcome today .

documents.title: preston memories from popeyleeds v preston
text: memories of preston games are mixed for me .
the play-off semi-final victory over two games in 2006 was awesome .
the away performance was particularly stunning but i always remember thinking the red cards for crainey and cresswell would prove costly for the final against watford .
the other memory was the one-man blitzkrieg that was preston 's jon parkin .
his hat trick demolished leeds .
6-a few years back , despite united leading 4-1 at half-time .
author: Adam Pope
BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: grayson returns to elland roadleeds v preston
text: today sees a welcome return to elland road for former leeds boss simon grayson .
grayson managed leeds from 2008-2012 and matched don revie 's record in his first season of 11 consecutive home victories .
he helped leeds to promotion to the championship in may 2010 where they finished second .
he was sacked in 2012 after a run of poor results and he joined huddersfield town before moving on to preston .

documents.title: popey on today 's gameleeds v preston
text: the significance of today 's game is that victory for leeds will send them within five points of the top six .
not that i 'm predicting play-off positions but a third win in four would show a real sign of improvement and , dare i say it , some stability ?
author: Adam Pope
BBC West Yorkshire Sport

documents.title: noel on today 's teamleeds v preston
text: it must have been a difficult decision for steve evans .
when players do well when they come on , they have a case to start the game but he 's obviously stuck with what he knows .
i 'm surprised but i 'm not ; evans does like that formation and when it works , it works really well .
author: Noel Whelan
Ex-Leeds United striker

documents.title: breakingteam newsleeds v preston
text: steve evans has made just the one change to his winning side from thursday night .
luke murphy will replace tom adeyemi in the starting line-up , with soulemayne doukara on the bench again .
leeds united xi : silvestri , wootton , bellusci , cooper , taylor , byram , bridcutt , murphy , cook , dallas , wood .
preston north end xi : pickford , cunningham , clarke , huntington , vermijl , welsh , gallagher , browne , reach , keane and garner .

documents.title: good afternoonleeds v preston
text: good afternoon and welcome to today 's live coverage of leeds united v preston north end .
leeds are riding high after a convincing victory at wolves on thursday night .
it 's been a different story at elland road for leeds this season , where they struggled to win for so long - can they make it three victories in four ?
keep an eye on us here while you enjoy our commentary on 92.4 fm and freeview channel 719 to see if leeds can continue their winning streak .
